alert.note: Alert for Allegany; Cattaraugus; Niagara; Northern Erie; Southern Erie; Wyoming (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 18 at 9:25AM EST by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...A BAND OF BRIEF HEAVY SNOW WILL AFFECT SOUTHWESTERN WYOMING... NORTHEASTERN CATTARAUGUS...ERIE...NIAGARA AND WEST CENTRAL ALLEGANY COUNTIES... At 922 AM EST, a narrow band of heavy snow producing sharply reduced visibilities was located along a line extending from near Fort Niagara State Park to near Erie Basin Marina to near Ashford. Movement was east at 20 mph. Locations impacted include... Buffalo, Cheektowaga, Niagara Falls, West Seneca, North Tonawanda, Clarence, Lockport, Lackawanna, Kenmore, Depew, Amherst, Tonawanda, Lancaster, Hamburg, East Aurora, Williamsville, Grand Island, Elma, Newfane and Boston. This includes the following highways... Interstate 90 between exits 57 and 49. Interstate 86 between exits 28 and 29. Visibilities will fall to below one quarter of a mile during this band of heavy snow. If you are driving, slow down and be on alert for other motorists. Low visibility shortens the amount of time you have to react to situations. A quick half inch of snow could occur. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time when traveling.
